history.content: Just called the CS Scheduling assistant, Mr. Sasson. The system should be updated by tomorrow morning

children.subject: It will be updated to the correct policy by tomorrow.

Same problem:

Error: You are unable to enroll in this class at this time. Available seats are reserved and you do not meet the reserve capacity requirements.

history.content: Students who are trying to sign up for 61C and 70 and are having trouble this morning should try again tomorrow morning. If it still doesn't work, let me know tomorrow and I'll escalate to campus.

children.subject: its classes in general I think

I'm not sure why there would be a problem with our upper div classes for students with senior standing (by units) at this time. It's not the same problem as for 61C/70.  I'll try to follow up with campus.
I'm enrolling for 170 and 188 and I'm having the same issue. What do you mean by senior standing with units?
90+ units at the end of SP16 including classes you are taking now and transfer/AP units.
Why would that be required for upper division classes?
http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Policies/enrollment.shtml
I have  senior standing. Currently have 108 units. I can't register in CS189 or CS161.
Got it, when importing shopping cart I didn't originally notice the waitlist checkbox, so it wasn't allowing me in yet. Checking that box fixed it.
That just puts you in the waitlist.
I have senior standing as well, but it won't let me enroll in CS160 or CS162.
The class I want to get into isn't an upper div class. Its DESINV 10 and it says the class and waitlist are full. Is this also going to be fixed?
Also, I have senior standing with AP credit (does with AP credit and without AP credit matter?) but I can't do anything but put myself on the waitlist for my upper div classes.
I have senior standing by all standards (with AP, without AP, number of semesters, etc), and I'm being placed on the waitlist for all upper division CS classes as well.

For now it seems like campus is unable to effectively implement enrollment screens that include AP units (despite what we were told until about 3 minutes ago). They have switched the existing CS upper div screens to allow students to enroll who will be seniors by # of semesters in attendance as of F16.  That should work for 4th year seniors by no later than tomorrow but won't help many who are seniors by unit and are included in those we meant to have access.

This is by no means an effective solution to what our intentions about access to the classes should be.

We will try to figure something out but since we were given no warning about this limitation from campus it may take us a few days to figure out how to handle it.  Thanks everyone for flagging this and I'm so sorry this is happening.

I beg of everyone a little patience now and I will let you know here as soon as anything else is implemented.

PS I'm not sure about the DESINV classes. The problem there may be similar or it might be unrelated.

Hey Michael, could you just clarify what this means? CalCentral says I have 96.9 units, this is 85 without AP. However, this doesn't seem to include In Progress units. I'm a third year junior (it's my 6th semester here), so next semester, I will be officially a senior. Since I only have 5 "completed" semesters and 6 if you include in progress, does this mean I will not have senior standing? What number of semesters is used to justify senior standing, and and does it include IP semesters/units? Including IP units, I should have 98 units (109.9 with AP). Thanks in advance!

I am  having this problem and I do not have any AP units. I currently have 108 units, and will have 120 by the end of this semester. None of those units are AP units. I still am unable to register for any of my CS classes. Is my issue different, or will I also be able to enroll tomorrow?
This is also happening with CS168. My EECS and CS friends both are unable to enroll in them

The malfunctioning enrollment requirement screens seem to have made it impossible for everyone (or almost everyone) to enroll in upper div cs classes.

I believe you will be able to enroll in upper div cs classes by later this morning (by 10:30am or so). Please try again then and if it's still not fixed again this afternoon and finally tomorrow morning.  I'm fairly certain you should be able to enroll by then but if not please reach out again late Wednesday afternoon.
What about other classes? This is happening for CS161 and CS189 too.

I believe you will be able to enroll in upper div cs classes by later this morning (by 10:30am or so). Please try again then and if it's still not fixed again this afternoon and finally tomorrow morning.  I'm fairly certain you should be able to enroll by then but if not please reach out again late Wednesday afternoon.
Given that we do not know when this issue will be fixed, should we choose to just join the waitlist for upper div cs classes or should we wait until we can enroll into the class itself?
+1, I was able to enroll in EE C106A without issue, but I'm pretty sure EECS/EE classes have different restrictions than CS.

Thanks for the report.

It's true that  since (other than 16A/B) EE and EECS courses have not had the same level of demand, those classes have generally been first come, first served with no enrollment restrictions.  The problem has been with enrollment requirement screens in SIS and that has only impacted CS courses.

@Michael-David Sasson if it helps for debugging, I was able to enroll in EECS 149 with no problem (which is listed under EECS, as opposed to CS), although there is no discussion section listed, which might be a problem. On the other hand, I am getting the same error as everyone else for CS 188. So perhaps it is only a problem for courses listed under CS? And, for reference, I have 88 units according to CalCentral, not including AP's or courses currently enrolled in. Considering courses currently enrolled, I will have 100 units in the fall, so I should be considered a senior, according to your post above.
+1. I receive the same message, despite being able to access enrollment earlier today.
I'm the guy who started this post and getting the same thing. Maybe its updates in progress? Further breaking of the system trying to fix it? Who knows...
+1. I'm getting the same. I made a ticket and will update if I get a response.

So a few minutes ago I had access to the registration system. I was able to look up classes and put them in my shopping cart. Now when I try to do anything, like add a class, I get this error:


You are not authorized to access this component. (40,20)

You have not been granted security authorization for the component you are attempting to access. You may have access to the designated component and page, but not in the specified action mode (such as Correction or Update/Display).  Contact your system administrator.

I believe you will be able to enroll in upper div cs classes by later this morning (by 10:30am or so). Please try again then and if it's still not fixed again this afternoon and finally tomorrow morning.  I'm fairly certain you should be able to enroll by then but if not please reach out again late Wednesday afternoon.

In case it helps with troubleshooting, when trying to enroll in CS 162 and CS 194-26 earlier today, I got the same error ("You are unable to enroll in this class at this time. Available seats are reserved and you do not meet the reserve capacity requirements"). I am currently a sophomore standing by year, and senior standing by credits.

I believe this will only work if you are entering your 4th year and won't help seniors by units.

SIS project staff told me very recently (this afternoon) that SIS will not be able to note class standing by unit until at least August 24 or so (if ever).  This is different than information that I had heard before but here we are.

At this point, for both phase 1 or phase 2 of enrollments we will change the screen so that anyone who is officially declared LSCS or EECS will be able to enroll in upper div cs classes.  This means seniors will have a shorter window of getting to enroll ahead of juniors or sophomores.

I really apologize for not being able to share clear information earlier.  I had repeatedly asked for clarity about SIS system capabilities for 4-5 months specifically so that we could change our enrollment procedures if necessary and so we could give you accurate information by the time the schedule of classes went live if not before.  I wasn't provided with that information until just now.
I just tried again and I can now add classes as I should be able to. If you're going to be a senior, try again!

history.content:
Hello, I'm an undeclared L&S CS major trying to enroll in CS61C for the fall, but I'm unable to enroll in the class on calcentral. "You are unable to enroll in this class at this time. Available seats are reserved and you do not meet the reserve capacity requirements. "

It says I do not meet the reserve capacity requirements, yet the CS enrollment policy is as follows, "Any EECS major or undeclared COE student may enroll directly into these classes provided there is space. Undeclared L&S students who are first or second year undergraduates will also be able to enroll directly into these classes; third year undergraduates who are undeclared L&S students would be treated similarly for Fall semester classes only and then only for CS 61C and CS 70. Other students will be able to place themselves on the waitlist."

Edit: I'm unable to directly enroll into the class and must waitlist.

Please help, what do I do?
history.subject: Enrollment error?
